Building Success with the 7 Megatrends for 2024
In today's era, our world is filled with rapid changes driven by the leaps in digital technology. So, regardless of which aspect of life, we must always be prepared to cope with these changes, especially for entrepreneurs striving for business success.
Today, let's explore "
Megatrends
," which are global-level trends that both marketers and the global population must understand!
What are Megatrends?
Megatrends are global-scale waves of change that impact every aspect of life. They often occur slowly but have lasting and far-reaching effects. These megatrends are driven by various factors such as technology, society, economy, environment, and more.
Why Should Businesses Prioritize Megatrends 2024?
Businesses need to prioritize megatrends because these trends are significant factors that impact business operations in various aspects. Here's why:
Strategic Planning
: Megatrends provide organizations with an overview of major changes that will occur in the future, enabling them to analyze opportunities and challenges. This helps in devising suitable strategies and adapting promptly.
Product and Service Development
: Understanding customer needs that evolve with Megatrends allows organizations to develop products and services that are relevant and contemporary.
Resource Management
: Key megatrends such as aging societies and social/environmental changes affect resource management practices such as human resource management, energy management, and sustainable development.
Competitive Adaptation
: Megatrends may introduce new competitors or new competition formats. So, organizations need to closely monitor trends to maintain competitiveness.
Building Trust
: Prioritizing Megatrends demonstrates an organization's vision and responsibility towards society and the environment, building trust and acceptance among stakeholders.
In conclusion, tracking, analyzing, and prioritizing megatrends 2024 is crucial for organizations to effectively plan and adapt to significant changes.
7 Megatrends for 2024 That Are Worth Noting
1. Urbanization
The world's population continues to migrate towards cities at an increasing rate. Current statistics show that more than half of the world's population resides in urban areas, and it is projected to increase to 68% by 2050. This trend results in densely populated megacities that must cope with challenges such as housing, traffic, pollution, and social inequality. Hence, there is a necessity for modernized infrastructure, efficient public transportation, and proper urban planning to ensure a high quality of life for citizens.
2. Climate Change
The world is currently facing increasingly severe effects of global warming, impacting the environment, economy, and society significantly. Many countries are now prioritizing reducing greenhouse gas emissions, transitioning to clean energy, and adopting more environmentally-friendly production and consumption practices, such as reducing plastic usage, utilizing recyclable packaging, and practicing organic farming.
3. Shifting Economic Power
In recent years, there has been a significant shift in the global economy, especially with the rapid growth of developing countries like China, India, and Singapore, while developed economies experience a slowdown. This shift necessitates businesses to adapt their strategies, such as expanding into growing economies and innovating to enhance competitiveness.
4. Growing Sustainability
With various changes occurring, many businesses have realized the necessity of reducing their environmental impact. They integrate sustainable development concepts into their operations, from production to services and supply chains, to ensure long-term quality growth. For example, leading cosmetics and skincare companies are reformulating products to be organic and cruelty-free to meet the preferences of modern consumers, enabling organizations to sustainably grow.
5. Aging Society
The population is aging, coupled with a decreasing trend in childbirth, leading to the emergence of aging societies worldwide. This trend impacts healthcare systems, social security, and the demand for products and services related to elderly care, such as tourism, residential facilities, and various amenities. This trend requires attention from modern businesses.
6. Digital Lifestyle
Digital technology plays an increasingly significant role in daily life, transforming various aspects such as work, education, shopping, and services onto online platforms. This necessitates businesses to adapt and develop digital channels to provide convenience and meet customer demands, remaining competitive in the digital age.
7. Industry 5.0: Human-AI Collaboration
AI technology is increasingly integrated into industries to enhance efficiency in production and services. This requires both employees to adapt their skills to work alongside AI systems and businesses to invest in AI to elevate their production standards, meeting the demands of digital consumers.

The World of O2O Marketing and Customer Experience Synergy
Even though online marketing is crucial in today's business landscape, don't forget that there are still a considerable number of consumers who enjoy shopping in-store. So, integrating online and offline marketing channels, known as O2O (Online to Offline) Marketing, is something not to be overlooked. By focusing on providing excellent
customer experiences (CX)
, businesses can stand out from competitors, even if they operate within the same industry.
What is Customer Experience (CX)?
Customer Experience (CX) is the entirety of experiences that customers receive from interacting with a brand, product, or service,
starting from before the purchase, during the purchase, and after the purchase. CX encompasses every touchpoint between the customer and the brand, whether it's advertising, sales, customer service, product usage, or even communication through various online and offline media.
In this regard, the key components of customer experience are creating experiences that are impressive, convenient, and valuable to customers in order to foster brand loyalty and stimulate repeat purchases in the future. So, creating CX is considered a crucial key to competing in the era of Marketing 5.0.
Why is it Important to Create a Blended CX Between Online and Offline channels?
Currently, consumer behavior has shifted towards more diverse channels for brand interaction and purchasing, whether it be online or offline. Therefore, creating a blended customer experience across these two channels is crucial for the following reasons:
Meeting the needs of modern consumers
who lead a blended lifestyle between the online and offline worlds, resulting in smoother and more convenient purchasing experiences for products or services.
Fostering strong relationships with customers
as brands can consistently engage with customers both online and offline, leading to tighter bonds with customers.
Enhancing sales and marketing efficiency
by leveraging data from various channels to analyze and improve strategies to better meet customer needs.
Setting oneself apart and standing out from competitors
by offering seamless and comprehensive experiences across all channels, while other competitors may prioritize only one channel.
Increasing profit opportunities and building customer loyalty
as customers who have positive experiences both online and offline are more likely to be impressed, leading to repeat purchases and word-of-mouth recommendations to others.
5 Techniques for Integrating Online and Offline Customer Experience
Know Your Customers
Gathering Demographic Data, Lifestyle Patterns, Purchasing Behaviors, and Preferences of Target Audiences from Both Online and Offline Channels
Analyze the collected data to gain deep understanding of customers, including their needs, current challenges, strengths, weaknesses, etc.
Utilize the information to strategize marketing efforts and create experiences that best resonate with customers.
Deliver a Seamless Cross-Channel Experience
Merge online and in-store purchasing channels smoothly, including product information, post-sale services, payment processes, etc.
Provide convenience for customers to initiate purchases from one channel and seamlessly transition to another. For example, customers can browse products online, reserve them, then pay in-store, or they can try products in-store and later order them online.
Integrate customer databases between the two channels so that sales staff can access customer purchase history anywhere.
Harnessing Technology Benefits
Utilize AI to analyze customer data such as preferences, purchase history, and provide tailored product recommendations accurately.
Leverage the
Metaverse
and AR/VR to create exciting shopping experiences, making it feel like customers are physically in the store while browsing through their mobile screens.
Allow customers to try on clothes or view products through AR/VR both online and in-store.
Organize special events
on the Metaverse for customers to participate in new and innovative formats.
Emphasizing Personalized Marketing
Utilize data from all platforms to deeply understand each customer, then tailor content, promotions, and experiences to match individual preferences and needs.
Send email notifications or special offers before appointments or after purchases to foster customer engagement.
Train staff to provide personalized care for customers both online and offline.
Selling offline and Building Online Relationships
Encourage customers who visit the store to engage with the brand online, such as signing up for newsletters or receiving special promotions via email or SMS.
Create marketing campaigns targeting customers who have visited the store before to maintain customer loyalty and stimulate repeat purchases.
Utilize online channels to gather feedback on satisfaction after in-store purchases, then use this feedback to improve and develop the store further.
Case Study
Currently, many businesses are increasingly adopting O2O marketing strategies to meet the needs of modern consumers, and a significant number of them have achieved success by creating seamless customer experiences between online and offline channels. In this article, we will showcase the "
DEmark Award
," a competition that integrates both channels effectively.
The DEmark Award is bestowed upon Thai products with excellent designs, organized by the Department of International Trade Promotion, Ministry of Commerce. Jenosize has facilitated convenience in the judging rounds, blending online and offline channels to create a superior customer experience for participants. We employ the following strategies:
Online Registration
: Participants can easily apply and submit their works through the website, making it convenient for interested individuals to join the competition.
Online Advertising and Promotion
: Utilize social media platforms, websites, and various online media to promote the award, stimulating interest among Thai entrepreneurs to participate.
Offline Event
: Organize press conferences and product showcases to select works and present awards at ICONSIAM, providing contestants with opportunities to showcase their works to the public, creating real experiences and memorable impressions.
Real-time Presentation of Works
: Utilize iPads and real-time result submission systems to facilitate convenient, efficient, and transparent judging by the panel.
The result of DEmark's customer experience initiative is an unprecedented participation of over 650 contestants, the highest number since the competition's inception. Additionally, the majority of participants expressed satisfaction with the event format, citing its convenience, efficiency, modernity, and ability to create a positive experience.
Both customer experience creation and O2O Marketing are complementary strategies necessary for enhancing brand loyalty among customers. For those interested in innovating customer experiences by immersing their brand into the virtual world,

offers "
Brandverse

The Brand Building Process Beyond Marketplaces
Many people believe the goal of online marketing is simply to drive sales — and while that’s not wrong, anyone running a business knows that the first sale is just the beginning of a much more important, long-term journey. In today’s world where customers have endless choices, success isn’t about who sells first — it’s about who can make customers come back again and again.
Selling on marketplaces may help you gain new customers today, but if they don’t return tomorrow, your business ends up starting from scratch every day. The real question is: wouldn’t it be better to have a system where every click, every order, and every referral contributes to long-term customer relationships — automatically?
Why Relying Solely on Marketplaces Could Be Holding Back Your Brand Building Success
Commission Fees Up to 20–30%
One of the biggest hidden costs of marketplace selling is the high commission and platform fees. Some platforms take as much as 30% of your total sales revenue. This significantly reduces your profit per item, leaving less to invest in product development or future branding strategies.
No Access to Customer Data
A major limitation of selling on marketplaces is that you don’t get direct access to customer data like emails, phone numbers, or purchasing behavior. Yet, this information is essential in the brand building process, helping you tailor communication, launch personalized campaigns, and improve customer retention.
Limited Ability to Build Long-Term Customer Relationships
Marketplace sales don’t align with core branding principles, as you’re essentially “renting space” on someone else’s platform. This prevents your brand from forming emotional bonds with customers or delivering the kind of personalized experience that fosters loyalty.
Easy for Customers to Switch to Competitors
Without a unique brand experience or value proposition, marketplace customers often compare solely on price. If a competitor offers a lower price, they’ll easily win the sale. This is a critical risk for brands that haven’t yet built strong identity or differentiation.
What Is a Loyalty Program — and Why Do Modern Businesses Need One?
In today’s competitive branding landscape, creating deep customer connections is key. One of the most effective tools in the brand building process is a loyalty program — a reward system offering points, perks, and exclusive benefits to repeat customers.
Reduce Customer Acquisition Costs (CAC)
Acquiring a new customer costs up to five times more than retaining an existing one. Investing in a Loyalty Program helps encourage repeat purchases, significantly lowering your overall acquisition costs.
Increase Average Order Value (AOV)
When customers feel that “the more they buy, the more they benefit,” they naturally tend to spend more. Well-designed point systems and member-only promotions incentivize larger purchases — without feeling like a hard sell.
Boost Repeat Purchases
The ultimate goal of brand building is creating a loyal customer base. A Loyalty Program keeps your brand top-of-mind, driving repeat purchases through rewards that offer both emotional and tangible value.
Enhance Word-of-Mouth Marketing
Happy customers who feel valued by your brand often become advocates — sharing their experience with friends and family. This type of word-of-mouth marketing is more trustworthy than traditional ads and helps expand your customer base at a lower cost.
EverydayCustomer: The Modern Business Solution for Brand Building
In an age where marketplaces charge 20–30% commissions and limit access to customer data, building your own platform is one of smart and sustainable branding principles.

— consolidating all essential business tools in one place:

Create a seamless online storefront with inventory, coupon, and order management — no coding required.

Encourage repeat purchases and increase brand loyalty through customizable membership benefits and reward tiers.
LINE, Facebook, IG, and TikTok Integration:
Combine all your social channels into one platform, enabling seamless omnichannel commerce experiences.
Referral Program:
Let customers refer friends via QR codes or custom links and reward them with exclusive discounts or gifts.
AI-Generated SEO Content:
Save time on content creation with AI that automatically writes SEO-friendly product descriptions, promotions, and blog posts.
One-Page Checkout:
Simplify the buying process and increase conversion rates with a fast, user-friendly checkout experience that supports QR payments and credit cards.
Online–Offline Customer Data Sync:
Capture customer data both in-store and online, allowing for precise marketing plans and data-driven brand building decisions.
In today’s world, sales aren’t just numbers on a dashboard — they’re the starting point for meaningful, long-term relationships. Businesses that truly grow aren’t just good at selling — they’re good at understanding their customers and making them want to come back.
Sustainable branding doesn’t come from chasing new customers every day, but from delivering great experiences to the ones you already have. That’s where smart loyalty systems, engaging reward programs, and valuable referrals come into play.

7 Sensory Experience Techniques to Make a Lasting Impression
In a time when people are more willing to pay for experiences than for products, events have become more than just promotional activities or brand showcases—they’re now powerful tools for building meaningful connections between brands and consumers. The more an event can impress attendees to the point where they feel like they “don’t want to leave,” the clearer the signal that the brand has delivered a quality experience.
This kind of success doesn’t happen by chance. It’s the result of intentional planning, design, and meticulous attention to every detail of the event experience—anchored in what’s known as a
sensory experience
. Here’s how leveraging all seven senses can turn attendees into loyal brand advocates who keep coming back for more.
What Is a Sensory Experience?
A sensory experience refers to a marketing approach that engages the human senses—sight, sound, smell, taste, touch, as well as emotional and spiritual dimensions.
By appealing to these senses, brands create immersive environments that foster deep emotional engagement and personal connection.
Brands that master the art of crafting sensory experiences don’t just make an impression—they embed themselves in memory. It’s not just about awareness; it’s about emotion and attachment. This depth of connection is what fuels long-term brand loyalty and drives organic word of mouth.
7 Sensory Experience Techniques for Designing Unforgettable Event Experiences
1. Stimulate Sight
"Attract from the first glance with a design that reflects your brand identity."
Visual presentation is the gateway to your brand’s universe. Elements like spatial design, lighting, brand colors, logos, and stage visuals should clearly reflect the brand image. Using brand-consistent color palettes, lighting that complements the mood, and Instagram-worthy photo spots can organically boost online sharing and visibility.
2. Engage Taste
"A great taste lingers longer than any words."
Food and beverages aren’t just refreshments—they’re storytelling tools. Curate menus that align with your event’s theme, incorporate local flavors to set the scene, or even develop signature drinks and treats that reflect your brand identity. Each bite becomes an extension of your brand narrative.
3. Evoke Memory Through Smell
"Scent is the most powerful trigger of memory."
Scents have a surprising influence on mood and memory. Pleasant aromas throughout your event space can induce calmness, luxury, or energy. Align your fragrance strategy with the event theme—for example, lavender for wellness events or citrus scents for energizing environments.
4. Enliven the Atmosphere with Sound
"The right sound sets the right mood."
From playlists to ambient noise to human chatter, sound shapes the entire event experience. Choose music that fits the theme, add natural sounds like flowing water or birds for relaxation zones, or create custom sound design for product reveals. Every sound element should contribute to the overall sensory experience.
5. Activate Touch
"Tactile experiences create lasting impressions."
Touch adds a tangible dimension to your brand. Use textured materials in decor, offer hands-on product demos, or provide custom-designed giveaways. DIY or workshop zones are also effective, encouraging attendees to engage physically and emotionally with your brand.
6. Tap into Emotion
"When the heart feels, the brand stays."
Emotional engagement transforms experiences. Encourage attendees to share personal stories, use uplifting or inspiring content, or tell your brand’s story through short films. Emotionally charged moments—pride, joy, inspiration—convert passive guests into brand advocates.
7. Add Meaning Through Spirit
"Brands with purpose make a deeper impact."
True impact comes when experiences reflect the brand’s deeper values and mission. Include social impact initiatives, tie into environmental or cultural causes, or create space for guests to share dreams and beliefs. Let every moment mean more than just “fun”—make it meaningful.
Case Study: Brands That Successfully Used Sensory Experience to Win Over Audiences
Incorporating the sensory experience model in event planning doesn’t just create fleeting impressions. It can shift consumer behavior, boost conversions, and build lasting brand recognition. Here are two success stories that prove its effectiveness:
Traveloka: Engaging Travelers with Limited Space
As the travel industry began recovering post-COVID-19, regional platform Traveloka sought to reignite interest among travelers. With just a 30-square-meter booth in a high-traffic Bangkok mall, they partnered with Jenosize to run an activation campaign. Activities included mini-games, discount giveaways, and celebrity photo ops—maximizing impact within tight spatial constraints.
Results:
Over 200 attendees per day during the 3-day event
Significant lift in brand recall and online deal redemptions
MRT Purple Line: Redefining Public Perception
During the launch of Bangkok’s MRT Purple Line, the brand aimed to create a positive image despite fare concerns. Using both online and offline event strategies focused on sensory experiences, they successfully shifted customer perception.
Results:
Rebranded as “A New Year’s Gift” for commuters
70% increase in ridership during the campaign
Passengers began recognizing the long-term value and quality of the service
In a world where brands compete through experience rather than advertising, creating events that make attendees “never want to leave” becomes a competitive advantage. These seven techniques go beyond aesthetics—they foster emotional connection and long-term brand loyalty.

Lipstick Effect: Why We Still Buy Even in Tough Times?
When the global economy faces uncertainty, including declining GDP growth rates, rising unemployment numbers, or even constantly increasing prices of goods and services, consumers should realistically reduce spending on luxury or non-essential items. However, there is a fascinating
marketing
phenomenon that explains the opposite of what should be happening. This is known as the
"lipstick effect"
theory, which describes the tendency of consumers to continue purchasing small luxury items even during poor economic conditions.
What is the Lipstick Effect?
The lipstick effect is an economic theory that explains consumer behavior during economic downturns. It observes that consumers, especially women, tend to continue buying affordable luxury items such as lipstick, cosmetics, accessories, etc., even when they have to economize in other areas. This phenomenon demonstrates that even during tough economic times, people still desire small pleasures and positive feelings from purchasing items that make them feel better about themselves.
The History of the Lipstick Effect
The concept of the lipstick effect was first introduced by Leonard Lauder, the chairman of Estée Lauder Companies, in 2001. He observed that the company's lipstick sales increased significantly after the 9/11 events, a period when the U.S. economy was facing difficulties. Subsequently, this concept gained widespread attention and was subjected to in-depth studies by economists and marketers worldwide.
However, a similar phenomenon had been observed even earlier. During the Great Depression in the 1930s, lipstick sales also increased surprisingly. This demonstrates that the phenomenon is rooted in deep-seated human behavior and has recurred throughout history.
Reasons Behind the Lipstick Effect
Need for Confidence
During times of economic uncertainty, people often feel insecure and seek ways to boost their confidence. The solution lies in purchasing affordable cosmetics or beauty products, as these can help elevate self-worth and increase confidence without spending as much as on larger luxury items.
Changing Spending Patterns
When the economy is poor, consumers tend to reduce spending on large, expensive items such as houses or cars. As a result, they turn to small luxuries for happiness, as these provide a sense of fulfillment without requiring significant expenditure.
Increased Emotional Value
During difficult times, small items like lipstick or perfume may have a greater emotional impact. They help consumers feel better when facing stress from economic uncertainty. Purchasing these items is like giving oneself a reward at an affordable price.
Social Mimicry
Even in tough economic times, people still want to maintain their social image. Therefore, buying affordable beauty or fashion items allows them to feel part of social trends and fashion without overspending.
The Impact of the Lipstick Effect on Economy and Business
Business Adaptation
Companies, especially in the beauty and fashion industries, often adjust their marketing strategies to respond to the lipstick effect. They may focus on producing smaller or more affordable items to attract consumers seeking small pleasures during economic downturns.
Business Risk Diversification
Companies with diverse product lines may leverage the lipstick effect by emphasizing the marketing of more affordable products to compensate for declining sales of expensive items.
Creation of New Business Opportunities
The lipstick effect may lead to the emergence of new businesses that focus on producing small luxury items or affordable luxuries to meet consumer demands during economic recessions.
Maintaining Economic Stability
Although small in scale, the lipstick effect can help maintain money circulation in the economic system, potentially alleviating some impacts of economic recession.
Long-term Changes in Consumer Behavior
The lipstick effect may result in long-term changes in consumer behavior, with consumers tending to place more importance on the value and cost-effectiveness of products, even after the economy recovers.
Examples of the Lipstick Effect in Thailand
During periods of economic difficulty in Thailand
, such as after the Tom Yum Kung crisis in 1997 or during the economic slowdown from 2017-2019, it was observed that female consumers showed increased interest in beauty products. According to a 2017 report by Kasikorn Research Center, the value of the cosmetics market in Thailand continued to grow by 6.5%, amounting to 168 billion baht. The facial product group, including lipsticks, had a high growth rate of 8%.
During the COVID-19 pandemic in Thailand
, which severely impacted the economy, many consumers chose to invest in skincare products for face and body, even while being more cautious about spending in other areas. Data from Euromonitor International reported that in 2020, the skincare product market in Thailand was valued at 47,700 million baht, growing 1.8% from the previous year, despite the overall economy contracting by 6.1%.
The lipstick effect is considered an interesting and important phenomenon in economics and marketing. Although it occurs during economic downturns, it demonstrates that consumers still desire small luxury items that can make them feel better. Understanding this phenomenon helps businesses adjust their marketing strategies and operations to align with consumer behavior in uncertain economic conditions. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of happiness and confidence in consumers' lives, which should not be overlooked even during economic recessions.

Spatial Computing & Immersive Tech: Opportunities for Retail
As we enter the era of marketing 5.0, it's undeniable that technology is playing a crucial role in driving various businesses forward, including retail. One of the powerful digital technologies emerging this year is "
Spatial Computing
" and "
Immersive Technology
," some of which are already being utilized by brands to create new opportunities. Whether it's creating captivating shopping experiences or offering personalized products and services, these technologies are leaving a lasting impression on customers, ultimately leading to increased revenue and long-term brand loyalty.
Let's delve deeper into both of these technologies and understand how incorporating these innovations can make retail businesses more efficient, contemporary, and stand out from the competition.
What is Spatial Computing?
Spatial Computing is the processing of spatial data
, a technology that merges the virtual world with the real world by creating digital environments and objects. In this digital format, everything in the real world, whether it's users, objects, or environments, can interact seamlessly with digital counterparts.
What is Immersive Technology?
Immersive Technology simulates a comprehensive
, lifelike experience by drawing users into a virtual environment, created through a combination of Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) technologies. This immersive experience encompasses visuals, sounds, and various sensory perceptions. A common example is VR headsets that transport wearers into entirely different environments, distinct from their physical surroundings, providing a fully immersive experience. A recent example is the Apple Vision Pro glasses, which represent Apple's first foray into spatial computing glasses, offering users an advanced immersive experience.
Implementing Spatial Computing & Immersive Technology in Retail Stores
Retail businesses can leverage Spatial Computing & Immersive Technology in various ways. Some common examples of their usage include:
Allowing Customers to Virtually Try Products
Retailers of clothing, shoes, jewelry, or cosmetics can utilize these innovations to enable customers to virtually try products before making a purchase decision. For instance, customers can try on clothes virtually without having to remove their current attire, or experiment with makeup looks without using actual cosmetics. This can be achieved through Computer Vision systems, leveraging techniques like machine learning and deep learning to track positions and movements, detect faces, and differentiate objects, coupled with AR technology.
In-Store Navigation
For larger retail outlets with a vast array of products, AR technology can be employed to create a 3D map of the store, allowing customers to easily and quickly locate items. Additionally, 3D scanning technology can be utilized to create a three-dimensional model of the interior space, including the positioning of products and various fixtures. This information can then be stored as digital data on a cloud-based system.
Automatic Payment Processing
Customers can make payments automatically without relying on cashiers, a feature already observed in retail businesses in China and the United States. This technology enhances convenience and reduces waiting times for customers. Key technologies utilized include facial recognition and identity verification systems, seamlessly linking to user accounts and payment information for swift transaction processing.
Distant Shopping Experience
Businesses can utilize VR technology to offer customers a virtual shopping experience without the need to physically visit the store. This goes beyond traditional online shopping, as it immerses customers in a virtual representation of the store, even while they're at home placing orders. It's another avenue to create a memorable experience for customers, making them feel as if they're truly inside the store, even when they're just browsing from the comfort of their homes.
The Benefits of Utilizing Spatial Computing and Immersive Tech in Retail Stores
Creating Memorable Customer Experiences
These technologies add a new dimension to the shopping experience for customers by allowing them to see, hear, and feel products virtually before making a purchase decision. When customers have a positive experience, it fosters a stronger connection with the business, ultimately leading to increased loyalty in the long run.
Enhancing Sales Efficiency
Retailers can present products in more detailed and engaging ways, reducing limitations in space and time for selling products and services. Additionally, they can provide more personalized recommendations tailored to customer needs, encouraging customers to return for repeat purchases.
Facilitating Accurate Data Analysis
AI technology enables business owners to gather detailed and comprehensive data on customer purchasing behaviors by tracking user interactions with the digital products we create. This information can then be analyzed to develop marketing strategies that are even more effective in the future.
Increasing Cross-Selling Opportunities
For instance, a customer may initially intend to buy a specific shirt, but when they try it on through virtual reality, the system may suggest a skirt that complements the shirt perfectly. If the customer likes how the outfit looks when they try it on, there's a greater chance of selling both items than just the initially intended purchase. This not only simplifies product recommendations but also boosts sales simultaneously.
Adopting spatial computing and immersive tech intelligently can elevate experiences for both businesses and customers. Customers can engage with products and shop in novel ways, leading to informed purchase decisions and long-term brand loyalty. Simultaneously, businesses can modernize their image, becoming memorable leaders in future innovation. However, it's crucial to prioritize customer privacy, obtaining consent for data collection and usage transparently to build trust.

content:

Motivation

HR จะทำยังไง ถ้าพนักงานลาออกเกิน 20% ต่อเดือน..
ธรรมชาติของเด็ก Gen ใหม่ มักจะลาออกจากงาน “ทันที”  หากพบว่าบริษัทที่ตัวเองอยู่ มีวิธีการทำงาน และวัฒนธรรมองค์กร ไม่ตรงกับสิ่งที่ตัวเองคิดไว้ แล้วถ้าบริษัท มีอัตราการลาออกของพนักงาน (Turnover Rate) สูงเกิน 20% จะแก้ไขปัญหายังไงได้บ้าง ?
อันดับแรก ต้องหาสาเหตุก่อน.. ว่าทำไม พนักงานถึงพร้อมใจกันลาออก ในเวลาไล่เลี่ยกัน
ขั้นที่ 1
การหาจำนวนพนักงานโดยเฉลี่ย  สูตรที่ใช้คำนวณ คือ (จำนวนพนักงานเริ่มต้น + จำนวนพนักงานล่าสุด) / 2 = จำนวนพนักงานโดยเฉลี่ย
ขั้นที่ 2
การหาอัตราการลาออกของพนักงาน (Turnover Rate) สูตรที่ใช้คำนวณ คือ (จำนวนพนักงานที่ลาออก / จำนวนพนักงานโดยเฉลี่ย) x 100 = อัตราการลาออกของพนักงาน (Turnover Rate)
ตัวอย่างการคำนวณหา Turnover Rate เช่น
บริษัท เจโนไซส์ ดิจิทัล กรุ๊ป จำกัด ในช่วงต้นเดือนมกราคม 2023 มีพนักงานรวมทั้งหมด 50 คน ในระหว่างปี 2023 มีพนักงานลาออก 5 คน และรับพนักงานใหม่เข้ามา 10 คน ดังนั้น เมื่อถึงสิ้นเดือนธันวาคม 2023 จะมีพนักงานรวมทั้งหมด 55 คน (ใช้ระยะห่าง 1 ปี ในการนับจำนวนพนักงาน)
สามารถคำนวณได้ ดังนี้
จำนวนพนักงานโดยเฉลี่ย = (50 + 55) / 2 = 52.5 คน
Turnover Rate = (5 / 52.5) x 100 = 9.5%
ดังนั้น บริษัท เจโนไซส์ ดิจิทัล กรุ๊ป จำกัด จะมี Turnover Rate ในปี 2023 อยู่ที่ 9.5%
ซึ่ง Turnover Rate ควรจะอยู่ที่ราวๆ 10-20%
หากคำนวณแล้วพบว่าเกิน 20% ในฐานะ HR ก็จะต้องหาให้เจอว่า อะไรคือสาเหตุที่ทำให้อัตราการลาออกของพนักงานนั้น สูง
อย่างไรก็ตาม ต้องพิจารณาด้วยว่า คู่แข่งในอุตสาหกรรมเดียวกัน มี Turnover Rate ที่เท่าไร เพื่อที่จะใช้เป็นค่ากลางในการเปรียบเทียบ
เมื่อหาอัตราการลาออกของพนักงานแล้ว พบว่ามีค่าสูงผิดปกติ เกิน 10-20% เราอาจใช้แบบสำรวจ ของ Jenosize เพื่อวัดความพึงพอใจของพนักงานเบื้องต้นได้ ลิงก์
https://forms.gle/SsyY47M7ij4X3Umq5
แบบสำรวจฉบับนี้ จัดทำขึ้นเพื่อสำรวจความพึงพอใจของพนักงาน  โดยจะนำข้อมูลที่ได้ ไปปรับปรุงรูปแบบการดำเนินงานของบริษัทฯ ให้เหมาะสมต่อไป
แบบสำรวจจะแบ่งออกเป็น 5 ส่วนประกอบ (ใช้เวลาประมาณ 15 นาทีในการตอบ)
ส่วนที่ 1 : ข้อมูลทั่วไป
ส่วนที่ 2 : คำถามสำรวจความผูกพัน (Engagement)
ส่วนที่ 3 : ปัจจัยที่ส่งผลต่อความพึงพอใจ และความผูกพันของพนักงานในองค์กร
โปรดตอบตามที่ท่านเห็นว่าตรงกับความเป็นจริง หรือความพึงพอใจของท่านมากที่สุด และกรุณาตอบให้ครบทุกข้อ
***ข้อมูลส่วนตัวของท่านจะถูกเก็บเป็นความลับ ไม่มีผลใดๆ ต่อตัวท่านหรือหน่วยงานของท่าน และใช้สำหรับการพัฒนาองค์กรในภาพรวมเท่านั้น***
“พนักงาน ยังรักองค์กรของคุณอยู่หรือเปล่า ?” นี่คือคำถามสำคัญ ที่ HR และผู้บริหารระดับสูงต้องตอบให้ได้
อย่ารอให้ซองขาวมากองเป็นตั้ง เคลียร์เรื่องค้างคาใจของพนักงานให้หมด ด้วย Employee Engagement Survey

Oligopoly Market: Fewer Competitors Doesn't Mean It's Easier
In the past, monopoly markets dominated the busines
s world. However, with stricter antitrust laws, large businesses began to break apart, giving rise to the oligopoly market—where o
nly a few sellers dominate.
Many people might think that having only a few competitors means more
business opportunities
, but in reality, the opposite is true! When the market is divided among just a few major players, competition intensifies significantly, with enormous budgets, complex strategies, and endless investments in innovation.
Let’s first understand: What is an Oligopoly Market?
An oligopoly market, or a ma
rket with few sellers, is a market structure dominated by only a small number of large companies.
Typically, there are at least two players but no more than ten. Each company holds a significant market share, so the decisions and business strategies of each player have a considerable impact on the overall market.
Another key characteristic of
an oligopoly market is that each company often has some power to set prices and control production levels. However, they cannot make these decisions entirely on their own, as they must consider potential reactions from other competitors. Additionally, entering an oligopoly market in Thailand
can be challenging due to several obstacles, including high capital investment requirements, the need for specialized technology or expertise, and regulatory constraints or licensing requirements.
Interesting Examples of Oligopoly Markets in Thailand and the Challenges Each Industry Faces
In Thailand, there are several industries with an oligopoly market structure, where only a few major players dominate the market. Each of these industries fa
ces unique challenges and competition. Here are some examples of oligopoly markets:
Thai Beer Market
The Thai beer market is a clear example of an oligopoly, with only a few key players, led by Boon Rawd Brewery (Singha) and Thai Beverage (Chang), which together control over 90% of the market share. A major challenge in this industry is the strict legal regulations, including advertising restrictions, production permits, and distribution laws, making it nearly impossible for new entrants to break into the market.
Airline Industry
The airline market in Thailand is also oligopolistic, with a few major players like Thai Airways, Thai AirAsia, Nok Air, and Thai Lion Air competing intensely. The challenges they face include high operating costs, such as fuel prices, aircraft maintenance, and fleet investments. Additionally, external factors like the COVID-19 crisis have had a severe impact on the aviation industry.
E-Commerce Platforms
Although relatively new, the e-commerce market in Thailand also shows oligopoly characteristics. Major players like Shopee, Lazada, and JD Central dominate the competition. The main challenges in this industry include massive investments in logistics infrastructure, high marketing costs, building consumer trust, and retaining customers in the face of fierce competition.
Mobile Telecommunications Market
The telecommunications market in Thailand is controlled by three major providers: AIS, DTAC, and TRUE. Each of these companies must invest heavily in infrastructure, including signal towers, frequency auctions, and the development of 5G technology. Major challenges include intense price competition, maintaining service quality, and generating additional revenue from digital services.
Food Delivery Apps
The food delivery app market in Thailand is dominated by Grab, foodpanda, and LINE MAN, which compete fiercely with each other. The challenges in this industry involve balancing revenue and costs, maintaining service quality, managing riders, and competing with high-cost promotions. Moreover, continuous technological development is necessary to enhance service efficiency.
Why Do Businesses in an Oligopoly Market Have to Invest More Than Expected?
Many people might think that doing business in an oligopoly market (with few sellers) is easier than in a competitive market. However, the reality is quite the opposite. The oligopoly market comes with both advantages and disadvantages. Let's explore why this is the case:
High Barriers to Entry
The reason there are only a few sellers in a
n oligopoly market is not th
at no one wants to enter, but because there are many obstacles to entry. Some of these include:
Massive Initial Investment:
For example, in the telecommunications business, companies need to invest in networks, signal towers, and frequency auctions, which can cost billions of baht.
Continuous Investment in Technology and Innovation:
Businesses must constantly invest in technology development, such as the 5G rollout in telecommunications or platform development in e-commerce.
Regulatory Requirements:
Companies must secure licenses, pass standard inspections, and comply with strict regulations. This process involves both time and money.
Intense Competition
Although there are few players in the market, the competition
in an oligopoly market is o
ften fiercer than in typical markets because:
Intense Marketing Competition:
Businesses must allocate enormous budgets for advertising and promotions. For example, food delivery platforms continuously offer discounts and promotions to stay competitive.
Constant Product and Service Development:
Companies must always invest in developing new products and services to maintain a competitive edge.
Market Share Maintenance:
As market share increases, companies must invest more resources to retain their customer base.
Higher Consumer Expectations Than in Competitive Markets
Being a major player in the market means dealing with higher consumer expectations, including:
Service Standards:
Consumers expect premium services, such as in the airline industry, where safety and high-level customer service standards must be maintained at all times.
Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR):
Companies need to invest in CSR activities and build a positive corporate image.
Crisis Management:
When issues arise, consumers expect quick and effective resolutions, such as when a bank's system crashes or mobile signals are disrupted.
Being a player in an oligopoly market may s
eem advantageous due to having fewer competitors, but in reality, such markets come with both pros and cons. Companies must invest more resources and effort than many might think to maintain their leadership and meet the ever-increasing consumer expectations.
So, the answer to the question, "Is it easier to sell when there are fewer competitors?" is clearly "No." The true challenge does not lie in the number of competitors, but in the scale of investment required and the high expectations of the market.

Hybrid Working: The Model Revolutionizing the Business World
Since the outbreak of COVID-19, the world of work has changed significantly. The pandemic has forced organizations to adapt and find new ways of working. One of the concepts that has gained
immense popularity is
"Hybrid Working,"
which involves alternating between work in the office and work from home. Even today
, many organizations continue to adhere to this work model, and new-generation employees are increasingly seeking
work-from-home jobs.
Many have discovered that the combination of working from home and going to the office better enhances their work-life balance compared to going to the office every day, while also saving costs in various areas.
Therefore, the qu
estion arises: Is hybrid work model the stand
ard for modern work? And why should organizations adapt to the new normal by changing their work models? Let's
What is Hybrid Working?
Hybrid working is a work model that allows employees to alternate between work in the office and work from home (or ot
her locations) as appropriate.
This concept combines the advantages of working in the office and remote work, focusing on flexibility and productivity.
In
a hybrid working setup, employees may have a predetermined schedule specifying office days and work-from-home days or have the freedom to choose their work locations based on the needs of their tasks and persona
l preferences. This depends on the organization's policies and the nature of each position.
The Benefits of Hybrid Working That Appeal to New-generation Employees
Improved time and personal life management
The hybrid work model enables
employees to effectively balance their work and personal lives. The freedom to choose where to work helps reduce stress from commuting and increases time for family or hobbies, leading to an overall improvement in quality of life and higher job satisfaction.
Cost savings
Work from home on cer
tain days allows employees to save significantly on expenses, especially commuting and food costs, which can be high for those working in large cities. Additionally, it reduces expenses related to dressing for office work.
Increased efficiency and creativity
Hybrid working provides employees with the opportunity to select work environments that suit them and the nature of their tasks each
day, enabling better focus on their work and stimulating creativity and innovation.
Reduced fatigue from commuting
For employees who live far from the office, reducing the number of days spent commuting significantly alleviates fatigue and stress from traffic congestion, allowing them to have more energy and motivation for their work.
Reasons Why Organizations Should Adopt Hybrid Working
To attract and retain talented personnel
Companies are currently competing to attract highly skilled personnel. Offering a hybrid work model serves as a key selling point for organizations, especially among new-generation workers who prioritize flexibility. Furthermore, it helps organizations retain tale
nted employees longer since they experience higher job satisfaction.
To promote a modern organizational image
Implementing hybrid working demonstrates that an organization is modern, understands employee needs, and values work-life balance, which enhances its public image and attracts quality clients and employees.
To improve efficiency and reduce costs
Hybrid working enables
organizations to lower expenses related to space and utilities, as it is not necessary to have workspace for every employee simultaneously. It also enhances overall work efficiency, as employees are more satisfied and motivated.
To prepare for change
The work environment is rapidly changing. Adop
ting hybrid working allows organizations to remain flexible and ready to handle unforeseen situations, such as pande
mics or natural disasters that may impact office work.
To expand recruitment opportunities
Hybrid working open
s opportunities for organizations to hire talented employees from around the world, not limited to those in close proximity to the office, leading to a broader and higher-quality recruitment pool.
Future Trends of Hybrid Working
According to surveys and predictions from experts, there is a clear trend that work-from-home jobs will become an increasingly prevalent work model in the future, supported by the following factors:
Hybrid workplace is gaining acceptance from leading organizations
Major companies in the technology sector, such as Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce, have officially announced
permanent hybrid working polic
ies. This trend is likely to encourage other organizations to consider adopting this model as well.
Becoming a basic requirement for new-generation workers
Millennials and Gen Z, who will become the primary workforce in the future, place great
importance on flexibility and work-life balance. As a result, hybrid work is the model that best meets their needs.
Changes in urban structure
Hybrid working may lead to a more disp
ersed distribution of housing and workplaces, reducing congestion in large cities and stimulating the economy in suburban areas or smaller towns.
Increased emphasis on health and well-being
After the COVID-19 pandemic, people are placing greater importance on health and well-being.
Hybrid working addr
esses this need by reducing the risk of disease transmission and enhancing employees' quality of life.
In summary, the hybrid work model is likely to become a s
tandard for modern work. Despite some challenges, the benefits in terms of flexibility, productivity, and employee quality of life make this work model increasingly desirable. However, organizations must remember to plan carefully, invest in appropriate technology, and foster a corporate culture that supports flexible working to prepare for the transition into a new era of work that may change irreversibly.

Top 10 Megatrends 2025: Gear Up for a New Era of Innovation!
If we were living 20 years ago and someone suddenly told us that in the future, people would shop online, make payments through their phones, and hold meetings with colleagues worldwide through screens, it might have sounded unbelievable—something beyond our imagination in that era. But today, all these things have become so normal that we've almost forgotten how life was before technology changed it all.
So, what about the future from here? What
new innovations
will shape our world? This article will take you on a journey through the
"10
Megatrend
s of
2025"
set to shake up the world in the coming year. These aren’t just speculations; they are emerging trends that have already shown clear signs of becoming the driving force for massive change!
﻿
10 Megatrends of 2025 That Will Open New Horizons in the 6.0 Era
1. Generative AI as Both a Golden Opportunity and Risk for Business
Generative
AI
is rapidly revolutionizing technology and business sectors and will become one of the most signi
ficant megatrends in 2025. This innovati
on will bring both opportunities and challenges to organizations. On one hand, it can enhance efficiency, spark new ideas, and create unprecedented business opportunities, such as high-quality content creation in record time, big data analysis for insights, and the development of products and services that better meet customer needs. However, it also presents risks, including data security concerns, copyright issues, and potential impacts on the labor market. Businesses must develop strategies to leverage Generative AI ethically and responsibly, preparing for possible shifts in workforce dynamics.
2. Climate Action as an Urgent Mission, Driving Businesses Toward Sustainability
Climate change has intensified, making it an urgent mission for all sectors, especially businesses, to adopt more
sustainable models
. This shift is not only a social responsibility but also a business opportunity. Companies need to invest in clean technology, develop eco-friendly products, improve production efficiency, and set clear greenhouse gas reduction targets, all of which are becoming standard for businesses of all sizes.
3. Rising Inflation: Impact on Costs, Consumer Spending Power, and Monetary Policy
Another megatrend for 2025 is i
nflation, which is expected to have wide-reaching impacts on the economy, increasing production costs, reducing consumer purchasing power, and influencing central bank policies. To cope, businesses will need to refine cost management strategies, create flexible supply chains, and develop products that meet consumer needs in times of decreased purchasing power. Staying informed on
economic
and financial policies is crucial for long-term business planning.
4. Demographic Shifts: Preparing for a Multi-Generational Society
Demographic changes are leading to a new
megatrend—a mo
re age-diverse society. While some countries are becoming aging societies, others still have large youth populations. These shifts will significantly impact the labor market, social welfare, and consumption patterns. Businesses should develop products and services that cater to all age groups, create inclusive workplaces for multiple generations, and innovate in health and eldercare technologies, tapping into important business opportunities.
5. Rapid Technological Advancements
Technologies like AI, IoT, 5G, Quantum Computing, and Biotechnology are transforming all areas of society and the economy, creating new opportunities for innovation, efficiency, and solutions to global challenges. Organizations need to closely monitor
tech advancements
, invest in relevant technologies, and build digital skills within their teams while fostering a culture of innovation.
6. Shift in Global Economic Power with Greater Roles for Asian Countries
Asian countries, particularly China and India, are playing increasingly influential roles on the global economic stage, impacting trade, investment, and consumption patterns worldwide. Businesses must adapt their strategies to leverage opportunities and address challenges from
this megatrend. Und
erstanding the culture, consumer behavior, and legal frameworks in Asian markets can increase chances of success. Building partnerships with regional companies is also a key strategy for expanding markets and accessing new innovations.
7. Rapid Urbanization: Economic Opportunities and Innovation, but with Challenges
Major cities are becoming hubs for innovation, job creation, and economic growth, yet they also face resource management, pollution, and social inequality challenges. Businesses should adapt to meet urban consumer needs by developing smart city solutions and supporting sustainable urban initiatives, including investments in sustainable infrastructure, clean technology, and efficient public transportation systems.
8. Hybrid Work as the New Norm
Hybrid work, combining remote and in-office work, will become a global megatrend in the
future of work, enhancing flexibility and productivity for employees. Consequently, organizations must develop remote work-friendly technological infrastructure, foster a culture that supports hybrid work, and strengthen distributed team management skills. This will help attract and retain talented employees over the long term.
9. Transition from Fossil Fuels to Clean and Renewable Energy: A Key Step Towards a Sustainable Future
Investment in solar, wind, hydrogen energy, and energy storage technologies will significantly increase, along with stricter policies on greenhouse gas emissions. Businesses must adapt by investing in clean energy technologies, improving energy efficiency, and creating eco-friendly products and services. This transition also presents new business opportunities in the production and distribution of clean energy, the development of energy infrastructure, and energy management services.
10. Revolutionizing Transportation with Electric Vehicles, Autonomous Vehicles, and Shared Mobility
The development of electric vehicles, autonomous vehicles, and shared mobility concepts will greatly impact the automotive industry, transportation infrastructure, and urban lifestyles. To stay competitive, businesses in the automotive and transport sectors need to invest in electric vehicle and autonomous driving technologies, expand EV charging infrastructure, and establish business models that embrace shared mobility.
Understanding and adapting to t
hese megatrends will be esse
ntial for the success of governments, businesses, and people worldwide in the near future. As an entrepreneur, you should prepare to embrace change, invest in innovation, and develop new skills to take advantage of opportunities and effectively handle the challenges that will arise in 2025 and beyond.

6 Proven Time Management Techniques for Better Productivity
Many professionals often feel overwhelmed with their workload, or even when they have enough time, they struggle to prioritize tasks effectively. This leads to wasted time on non-essential tasks and missed opportunities for innovation. Effective time management is a crucial skill that allows professionals to focus on high-value tasks and achieve the best possible outcomes.
Discover 6 proven time management techniques that can help increase work efficiency. If you're ready to transform your work habits and enhance productivity, let's get started!
6 Time Management Techniques to Increase Work Efficiency
1. Eisenhower Matrix: Prioritizing Tasks Effectively
The Eisenhower Matrix is a time management technique developed by Dwight D. Eisenhower, the former President of the United States. This method helps professionals and business leaders categorize tasks based on urgency and importance, allowing them to manage multiple responsibilities effectively.
Tasks are divided into 4 categories:
Important and Urgent (Q1):
Critical tasks that require immediate attention, such as emergencies or approaching deadlines.
Important but Not Urgent (Q2):
Strategic planning, long-term projects, and personal development.
Not Important but Urgent (Q3):
Meetings, requests from others, and tasks that can be delegated.
Not Important and Not Urgent (Q4):
Time-wasting activities like excessive social media use without purpose.
To maximize efficiency with the Eisenhower Matrix, focus primarily on Q2 tasks, as they provide long-term value and reduce future urgent crises (Q1). Delegate Q3 tasks whenever possible and minimize or eliminate Q4 tasks.
2. The 80/20 Rule (Pareto Principle): Focus on High-Impact Tasks
The Pareto Principle, or 80/20 rule, states that 80% of results come from just 20% of efforts. When applied to time management, this means that a small portion of tasks contribute to the majority of success.
To apply the Pareto Principle effectively:
Analyze all tasks and identify which ones yield the highest impact.
Prioritize and allocate time to the most impactful tasks.
Reduce or eliminate low-value tasks that consume time without significant returns.
3. The 1-3-5 Method: Structuring Daily Priorities
The 1-3-5 Method is a simple yet one of highly effective time management techniques that helps professionals balance their workload and avoid feeling overwhelmed. This method ensures a sense of accomplishment while maintaining realistic daily goals.
Each day, focus on:
1 major task –
A high-priority task that requires significant time and effort.
3 medium tasks –
Important tasks that need attention but are not as demanding.
5 small tasks –
Quick, necessary tasks that can be completed efficiently.
Business leaders can adapt this approach by planning their workload in advance at the beginning of each week for better clarity and focus.
4. Eat Your Frog: Tackling the Toughest Task First
The "Eat Your Frog" method, inspired by Brian Tracy’s book and Mark Twain’s famous quote, encourages professionals to complete their most challenging task first thing in the morning. The rationale is that once the hardest task is done, the rest of the day will feel much easier.
Your "frog" refers to tasks that are:
The most difficult
The most tedious
The most important
Often procrastinated
This technique is particularly useful for entrepreneurs handling high-stakes negotiations, critical decision-making, or complex problem-solving.
5. Deep Work: Maximizing Productivity with Focused Work Sessions
Cal Newport’s Deep Work concept emphasizes the importance of focused, distraction-free work to enhance productivity and creativity. This method is ideal for strategic planning, innovation, and problem-solving.
To implement Deep Work:
Set dedicated time blocks (at least 1-2 hours) for deep work.
Eliminate distractions by turning off notifications, phones, and emails.
Choose a suitable work environment that fosters concentration.
Define clear goals for each deep work session.
Research by Gerald Weinberg shows that multitasking can reduce work efficiency by up to 80%. Establishing "no-interruption zones" in your workplace can significantly boost productivity.
6. The Pomodoro Technique: Working in Time Blocks
Developed by Francesco Cirillo in the late 1980s, the Pomodoro Technique is one of the time management skills that enhances focus and reduces mental fatigue by breaking work into short, structured intervals.
How to increase work efficiency by the Pomodoro Technique:
Set a 25-minute timer and work intensely without distractions.
Take a 5-minute break after each Pomodoro session.
This technique fosters a sense of urgency, improving focus and efficiency while preventing burnout.
Effective time management skills are a key driver of productivity and success. These 6 techniques offer flexible strategies to help you work smarter, whether managing personal projects or leading a team. The key is to select the method that aligns best with your work style and responsibilities. By refining your approach to time management, you can reduce stress, enhance efficiency, and unlock greater opportunities for success.
However, if you find time management challenging or need a more structured system, a
business consulting company
can provide customized strategies to optimize time management for your organization. Investing in the right approach today can lead to a more productive and fulfilling work life.

8 Interesting Startup Trends 2025 to Seize New Opportunities
In an era where everything is driven by innovation and digital transformation, starting an interesting startup is no longer just about having brilliant ideas or substantial funding. It also re
quires identifying the right timing and capitalizing on emerging startup trends. Entrepreneurs who can accurately seize these opportunities may transform themselves from emerging startups into leaders in the business world, making them interesting startups to watch in the coming years.
Looking ahead to startup trends in 2025, it’s clear tha
t current innovations go beyond merely producing goods and services to meet consumer demands. They focus on developing products that pave the way for a new future—one that benefits consumers, the people around you, and yourself. Consulting with experts in
digital consulting
could be a pivotal step to help you better recognize opportunities and challenges, setting you on the path to success.
8 Interesting Startups to Watch in 2025
1. Government Software
One of the fast-growing startups in 2025 is focused o
n developing software for government agencies. Although it is a challenging market to enter, it offers immense potential, as demonstrated by Palantir, with a market value of $125 billion. This trend is driven by governments seeking ways to cut costs and improve efficiency, particularly through AI solutions for administrative tasks such as form filling, application reviews, and document summarization. Governments currently a
llocate massive budgets for these tasks, making this one of emerging startup trends to watch.
2. Public Safety Technology
With growing societal concerns about safety, startups developing public safety technologies are gaining traction. A prime example is Flock Safety, whose license plate recognition cameras have helped solve 10% of reported crimes in the U.S. Another noteworthy player is Abel Police, which has reduced police report preparation time from hours to minutes,
enabling officers to increase on-ground activity by 25%. Public safety innovation remains one of trending startup businesses with high growth potential.
3. Stablecoins 2.0
Stablecoins are entering a new era of widespread adoption.
According to Y Combinator
, stablecoin transaction volumes now account for 20% of Mastercard's, with nearly 30% of cross-border transfers utilizing this technology. Leading financial institutions like Visa are developing platforms for banks to issue their own stablecoins. Stripe’s $1 billion acquisition of stablecoin startup Bridge highlights investor enthusiasm, making stablecoin technology a clear candidate for
the list of startups to watch in 2025. Op
portunities in this space include platforms for businesses to manage stablecoins and tools for developers to integrate stablecoins into their systems seamlessly.
4. LLMs for Chip Design
The rise of AI has driven demand for highly efficient chips, positioning chip design as a national priority in many countries. AI-powered solutions, such as OpenAI O1, have shown the potential to revolutionize science and engineering, particularly in designing ASICs and FPGAs. These AI-designe
d chips deliver 5-100x higher performance and consume 10-100x less power than traditional processors. This intersection of AI and hardware innovation is a groundbreaking field and a critical focus for startup trends in 2025.
5. Fintech 2.0
Despite challenges over the past two years, including the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and tightened regulations, Fintech startups are poised for a comeback in 2025. With new infrastructure like Stripe and stablecoin technology, starting a fintech business is now easier than ever.
AI tools
are transforming the financial sector, giving newer startups without legacy systems a competitive edge in creating global financial products. Key growth areas include insurance, investment banking, wealth management, and cross-border payments. This resurgence places fintech firmly among
the fast-growing startups of 2025.
6. New Space Companies
Since SpaceX revolutionized satellite launch costs, reducing expenses by over 10x, the space industry has become more accessible. Startups can now build and launch satellites with a single round of funding, opening up possibilities akin to air travel or trucking in the future.
Backed by organizations like Y Combinator, companies such as Astranis (satellite communication), Relativity Space, and Stoke are thriving. Success rates for space startups now rival or surpass those of software companies, making space exploration one of the most interesting startups to watch in this year.
7. AI-Aided Engineering Tools
The engineering tools for designing physical systems, from CAD/CAM to CFD software, have seen little advancement in decades. These tools often require complex simulations, significant computational resources, and highly specialized expertise. With next-generation AI capable of under
standing mathematics and physics, engineers can now design systems—such as aircraft, buildings, circuits, chips, and satellites—faster and more efficiently. This innovative field is reshaping engineering and is among the top trending startup businesses to monitor.
8. One Million Jobs 2.0
As AI disrupts traditional roles, businesses focused on creating one million human jobs that AI cannot replace are emerging as a powerful trend. Historically, technological shifts have transformed labor markets, often leading to better work conditions and entirely new roles. Startups in this space are likely to develop tools enabling individuals to start local businesses o
r provide online and offline services, fostering human-centric economic opportunities. This aligns with the goal of balancing automation with sustainable job creation, making it one of emerging startup trends in 2025.
Although the world
of startups in 2025 is filled with opportunities, it cannot be denied that challenges abound as well. If you can identify and act on emerging startup trends ahe
ad of others, it will enable you to become a leader in this competitive arena with confidence and poise. Partnering with a
digital consulting
expert can be a valuable resource to help you gain a clear perspective and overcome challenges with confidence.
Choose the trend that suits you and prepare to soar into a bright future that no one can stop, starting today!
